Reviews.Title: Due to high sensor density
Reviews.Author: Roblife
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this person in the other one star review expects superb low light performance from a camera that has 50 mega pixel capability. You got to realize this is due to ultra high sensor density. The more dense the sensor the less light per area. If you want superb low light capability use less dense sensor or low megapixel and fast lens. Say .85, 1.0, 1.2, 1.4 f stop.

Reviews.Title: UNIMPRESSIVE
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: After buying this highly over priced status symbol and useing it at a shoot I was unimpressed. I have returned it and will stick with my American RCA and buy a car with the money I save.  Better yet I will give the money to a food pantry and Sweden can go sell status symbols to want to be's with  lot of money and no talent.

Reviews.Title: Is Hasselblad French?
Reviews.Author: Krishna Sudarshan
Reviews.Content: Most people in America think Sweden is in Europe - actually it is not - it borders Russia which is where Hasselblad is from. Not France.But besides the point. This is one of the best cameras there is. But with 50MP pictures make sure you have a 5TB hard drive on your PC.

Reviews.Title: Over Priced!
Reviews.Author: Hilow "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Used this camera for a couple days and was totally disappointed. Low light performance sucked. I will be sticking to Panasonic from now on.

ProductInfo.Features: r. For ultra-high definition still photography a special multi-shot version
ProductInfo.Name: Hasselblad H3D II 50 Digital Camera 50MP
